author: yorickdowne
content:
March 2026 is almost here. I haven't heard much about a Sepolia replacement: I'm assuming it's been pushed.

What's the new timeline?

author: lightclient
content: I think since we did the hoodi -> hooli situation last year we're not jumping to churn the testnets again until a bit later since it is a lot of effort for everyone in the ecosystem to update tools, scripts, deployments, etc

author: pk910
content:
The funding situation is a lot better on sepolia as we have a lot of reserves left.
On the other side, the sepolia datadir reached a size of 640G now and it's getting more and more expensive to run sepolia nodes.
We shouldn't push it too far imo. The current schedule says we're going to launch a new testnet in april,  but keep running sepolia till at least end of year.
But yea, I think we could extend it by another year

author: pk910
content:
One more thing to consider:
Sepolia is the only testnet that ran though a PoW mining phase like mainnet.
Clients dropped the ability to mine, so we can only launch new testnets post bellatrix (or latest available fork).

author: lightclient
content: This is one unfortunate thing IMO, since sometimes we do need to test certain behaviors around pre-merge and post merge

author: lightclient
content: I wonder if we could hack something together where we run the start of the testnet in PoW using old client releases, then after a few weeks/months jump through the remaining forks
